docs.snippet: Mexico's battered peso currency reversed losses on Thursday after weakening more than 0.6 percent following a tweet from U.S. President-elect Donald Trump threatening Toyota Motor Corp with a "big border tax" if it builds a new factory in Mexico t...
docs.lead_paragraph: Mexico's battered peso currency reversed losses on Thursday after weakening more than 0.6 percent following a tweet from U.S. President-elect Donald Trump threatening Toyota Motor Corp with a "big border tax" if it builds a new factory in Mexico to build cars for the U.S. market.

headline.main: Mexico's Peso Reverses Losses After Weakening on Trump Toyota Threat
headline.print_headline: Mexico's Peso Reverses Losses After Weakening on Trump Toyota Threat
